page.title: 02ASHPERTON:TRADE COMMUNICAT'N
page.content: Ashperton village has no shop, no post office and no bus service to any shopping centre. It has two telephone boxes, two post boxes and two public houses. The nearest shop and post office combined lies one mile to the north, and there are four buses during the day to Ledbury and four to Hereford for anyone who is able to walk a mile to the south and catch them at the Trumpet crossroads. The population is dependent on private transport but there are many, both old and young, without their own transport and these are isolated. The bus companies claim that in these days of the private car it is not economic to run regular services in country areas. Two butchers deliver weekly in the village and the shop in Tarrington delivers groceries and bread.
